main event: A silver, half-circle shaped object was observed from an aircraft at 7,222 feet elevation for about 2 minutes.
interesting points: The object was larger than a basketball and disappeared as soon as the sun came up.
The object was observed at an elevation of 32 degrees above the horizon and 135 degrees from the observer's position.
The weather conditions were clear with unlimited visibility.
Wind speeds at various altitudes were reported, ranging from 12 to 59 knots.
The sighting was reported to various military commands, including the Air Defense Command and Air Technical Intelligence Center.
